channel.title: Getting the server up?
channel.description: Hello forum members, I have recently come back to Mopar after about a year off, and am wondering a few questions why my server is unaccessible. For starters, when I click my run-server batch file, it comes up with 0.0.0.0: 43594. Now, I'm sure an IP has to be there, and I'm not sure how to fix this problem. I have a No-IP, Forwarded the port, everything in this guide.. http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,285415.0.html

item.title: Getting the server up?
item.dc:creator: @antireversil antireversil
item.description:
@antireversil wrote:

thanks, fixed the problem. I misread the guide and put it under the default gateway, not my ip.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting the server up?
item.dc:creator: @Kindler Kindler
item.description:
@Kindler wrote:

this may be your problem… check that the portforward 43594 is under your ip adress

Read full topic

item.title: Getting the server up?
item.dc:creator: @antireversil antireversil
item.description:
@antireversil wrote:

Ok, I was just taking the precaution ahead of time, and it only took me like 10 minutes to set it all up, whereas my first time took about 6 hours… =X[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 09, 2008, 04:15:47 pm[/size][hr]Well, I’m still having an issue, my friend cannot connect to my server using the No-IP address I setup. (And yes, it is running…)

Read full topic

item.title: Getting the server up?
item.dc:creator: @ihackgames ihackgames
item.description:
@ihackgames wrote:

completely normal
actually thats the only way you the owner can get on

Read full topic

item.title: Getting the server up?
item.dc:creator: @antireversil antireversil
item.description:
@antireversil wrote:

I’m using Project 16 v6 right now, but I guess I do not need to type in the No-IP for the server when I use the client? I left it blank and got on, but when i typed the No-IP in it wouldn’t connect. So is that normal or is there a problem with No-IP now?

Read full topic

item.title: Getting the server up?
item.dc:creator: @Kindler Kindler
item.description:
@Kindler wrote:

what source r u using? if you use like pimpscape thats normal to say or the default port isnt correct

Read full topic

item.title: Getting the server up?
item.dc:creator: @antireversil antireversil
item.description:
@antireversil wrote:

Hello forum members, I have recently come back to Mopar after about a year off, and am wondering a few questions why my server is unaccessible. For starters, when I click my run-server batch file, it comes up with 0.0.0.0: 43594. Now, I’m sure an IP has to be there, and I’m not sure how to fix this problem. I have a No-IP, Forwarded the port, everything in this guide… http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,285415.0.html

Read full topic
